intro: Lysipomia mitsyae, commonly known as the Andean mountain grass, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, pale blue to purple flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests and alpine meadows. Due to its restricted habitat, Lysipomia mitsyae is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
